        break

The `while` loop code in your program must have the same format.

**Note: A `for` loop is the same as a `while` loop repeated a given number of times.**

### Input
The code will request input from the user to test.

### Output
The code must output the word and phrase based on the input selections.

### Code
All input is taken from the console. Print output to the console.

### Sample Input
```
1. What do you call a car on which 2 seats are side by side? What is the English name of the first car that was invented? (A: two door car, B: carriage)
```

```

```

## Solution 1

```JS
function program1(){
    for (;;){
        var input = prompt('Daily life task #1', 'Example: Cut fabric at the sewing room.');
        if(input == null)break;
        switch(input){
            case 'cut fabric':
                console.log('You can cut fabric into order at tailor shop.' );
                break;
            case 'carriage':
                console.error('You need to call the type of vehicle with 2 seats side by side.');
                break;
        }
    }
}
```

* A/An can only be used with a singular uncountable noun (with no article).
* The is a determiner that is used with a singular countable noun.
* A/an is used to refer to a non-specific person or thing.
* The is a definite article that is used to give a specific person or thing.

The answers to these questions are all located in the human body. 
Hairs: Human hair is a thin filament that grows from follicles in your skin. Your hair can come in colors such as white, brown, red, blonde or black. Some people have curly hair while others have straight hair. There are three types of hair found on your body including head hair and body hair. Head hair or cilia can grow on your head as well as your eyebrows. A unicellular organism contains cilia. An animal that has 3 pairs of cilia, 3 pairs of trichromes (fine hair like whiskers or bristles), 2 pairs of lateral lines (lines that can detect vibrations produced by waves and currents) and are all fish.
Hair grows in all mammals and birds and can come in different colors. A male cat, a male dog and a male bison will all have a mane or hair under their chins.

Hair grows from roots or follicles that are attached to your skin and grow into hair strands. The hair strand is made up of the keratin protein and hair under the human skin contains dead cells, fat cells, blood cells and sebaceous glands. Hairs have hair bulbs under them that contains pigment that gives the hair its color. There are three types, including vellus hair found all over the body, such as inside ears, hair found in genital area and pubic area as well as in armpits, eyelashes, eyebrows, top of the head and above the collarbone. There is also hair found on top of the head, side of head, behind ears which is referred to as the lanugo hair found in a fetus. The final type of hair is more coarse
